questionTitle: There's something wrong with my watch: it's ________ fifteen minutes in the last twelve hours.
If you are ________ to customers, they'll walk out of the shop.
The air in the house felt cold and ________ after weeks of bad weather.
Is it worth waiting for a table at this restaurant or shall we go ________ else?
Children who go up escalators should always be accompanied ________ an adult.
I took someone else's coat from the cloakroom by ________.
How long does it usually ________ to get home in the evening?
It is becoming more and more ________ that the Government has lost the confidence of the nation.
You need a special ________ to go into this part of the building.
I don't like him, so I have no intention ________ speaking to him.
We had to drive carefully because the road was icy in several ________.
Don't invite John to dinner; I can't stand his bad ________.
Not only ________ the film, but he had read the book as well.
I'm sorry I'm so late; we had a meeting at work which went ________ much longer than we expected.
He ________ me to take a lawyer to court with me.
Poor Mary! She has so much to cope ________.
He has always gone ________ strange hobbies like collecting bottle-tops and inventing secret codes.
As he is an expert on pottery, his opinions would be worth ________.
Nowhere ________ the bathrooms.
anwers: it is as cold as in

questionTitle: There's just something about him that really puts my ________ up. I can't stand being in the same room as him.
